title: Why is there no role selection for Blind Pick
body:
Is there a reason that only draft pick and ranked give the option to choose your primary and secondary roles?  Why doesn't blind pick have this option?  I have seen complaints far and wide about insta-lockers, to people who dodge because they didn't get their desired role.  Are there reasons that are not as obvious to why the role selection option is not available for blind pick.

Another thing, why is there no way to report players during champ select?  When people are rude, or say unspeakable things.  We can not report them, instead we have to play a whole game with that player/players and then report them at the end.

Maybe I am just ignorant to the ways of how Riot chooses to manage their player traffic, but I think at minimum the role selection for blind pick would be much appreciated by many.

Please vote in the poll.  Thank you for your time.

replies.body: Probably said it a hundred times already but, no one likes the calling lane in chat system Riot :)

Come the fuck on riot. The queues right now are 
A: you get your champion but you have to fight for your role
or B: you get your role, but your champ will probably be banned, and if not you get some sweaty tryhard picking their counter

Give us this at least

I think the queue would help but I'm not sure if it would resolve the overall problems given I'm seeing threads about the "queuing system" and people still instalocking against their assigned option. But it would be great not to see constant flooding in chat at the beginning.

{{champion:42}}
Should have been done ages ago, I guess this was thought of in the past.  I guess the Q times will be longer than a non role selection game.  I guess thats the reason why they havent created it.
takes too long and no consequences for dodging also hard to find anyone that gives a shit about normal games to not dodge.

As far as I'm concerned, the solution isn't to give Blind Pick role selections. Rather, the solution is to replace the standard Blind Pick system with a "banless" Draft Pick system. That way, "Call Order" (as it's commonly known) will make way for "Pick Order", which is superior in that it provides some kind of order to the chaos that exists in unranked games, rather than being based solely on who can type the fastest and who has the lowest ping (and potentially, who is using macros).
